results.description: Boston ferns are popular houseplants known for their feather-like leaves. They thrive in indirect sunlight and require consistent moisture.
results.origin: South and Central America, and the West Indies

care_instructions.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy
care_instructions.temperature: Cool to warm, with high humidity
care_instructions.feeding: Use a balanced liquid fertilizer every 2 months

results.description: Maidenhair Ferns feature delicate fan-shaped leaf segments, typically clustered on wiry black stems. They prefer high humidity and do well in bathrooms.

care_instructions.light: Partial shade and no direct sunlight
care_instructions.temperature: Prefer cooler temperatures and high humidity
care_instructions.feeding: Fertilize lightly during the growing season
